page.title: 17EDUCATION IN GRETTON
page.content:
In the 1850's, a school situated next to the Parish Church was opened. It was a Church of England School and was owned by the Earl of Winchelsea, the Lord of the Manor of Gretton. In 1870, it was extended because it was too small. The new building had three classrooms, two large and one small.
In 1909, this school closed, and a new one, the Gretton National School, opened at the other end of the village. This school took children from the age of 5 until they started work. The name changed later to the Gretton County Primary School, and now takes children from 4 to 11 years of age, when they are taken by bus to a Comprehensive School in Corby five miles away.
